exceptions.exn: In environment T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T Unable to unify "SF_h s :: (fix rcons (s : seq R) (z : R) {struct s} : seq R := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end) (unzip1 (SF_t s)) (let (x, _) := h in x)" with "SF_h (SF_rcons s h) :: unzip1 (SF_t (SF_rcons s h))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
s: SF_seq
h: (R * T)%type

Goal:
SF_lx (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_lx s) (fst h)

Premises:
rcons = fun T : Type => fix rcons (s : seq T) (z : T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end : forall T : Type, seq T -> T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope _]
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
SF_rcons = fun (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := rcons (SF_t s) t |} : SF_seq -> R * T -> SF_seq
SF_lx = fun s : SF_seq => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq R
*** [ R : Set ]
SF_cons = fun (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq
SF_seq_bij : forall s : SF_seq, SF_make (SF_lx s) (SF_ly s) (SF_size_lx_ly s) = s
SF_lx_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (size (SF_ly s))
SF_cons_rcons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) (l : R * T), SF_cons h (SF_rcons s l) = SF_rcons (SF_cons h s) l
lastI : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), x :: s = rcons (seq.belast x s) (last x s)
rcons_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), rcons (x :: s) z = x :: rcons s z
take_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> take (S n) s = rcons (take n s) (nth x0 s n)
rot1_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rot 1 (x :: s) = rcons s x
unzip1_rcons : forall (s0 : seq (?S * ?T)) (h0 : ?S * ?T), unzip1 (rcons s0 h0) = rcons (unzip1 s0) (fst h0) where ?S : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type] ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type]
drop_rcons : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq n0 (size s) -> forall x : T, drop n0 (rcons s x) = rcons (drop n0 s) x
rev_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rev (x :: s) = rcons (rev s) x
all2E : forall (S T : Type) (r : S -> T -> bool) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), all2 r s t = eqtype.eq_op (size s) (size t) && all (pred_of_simpl (T:=S * T) (SimplPred (fun xy : S * T => r (fst xy) (snd xy)))) (zip s t)
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
reshape_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (sh : seq nat) (n : nat), let m := sumn sh in ssrnat.addn m n = size s -> reshape (rcons sh n) s = rcons (reshape sh (take m s)) (drop m s)
SF_lx_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_lx (SF_nil x0) = [:: x0]
SF_rcons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_rcons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P s -> P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_t = fun s : SF_seq => let (_, SF_t) := s in SF_t : SF_seq -> seq (R * T)
SF_ly_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h s) = snd h :: SF_ly s
Rlist2seq_bij : forall s : seq R, Rlist2seq (seq2Rlist s) = s
SF_seq_bij_lx : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T) (Hs : size lx = S (size ly)), SF_lx (SF_make lx ly Hs) = lx
cats1 : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (z : T), s ++ [:: z] = rcons s z
headI : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), rcons s x = head x s :: behead (rcons s x)
unzip2_rcons : forall (s0 : seq (?S * ?T)) (h0 : ?S * ?T), unzip2 (rcons s0 h0) = rcons (unzip2 s0) (snd h0) where ?S : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type] ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type]
List.split_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : seq (A * B)) (n : nat) (d : A * B), List.nth n l d = (List.nth n (fst (List.split l)) (fst d), List.nth n (snd (List.split l)) (snd d))
prod_plus = fun (U V : AbelianGroup) (x y : U * V) => (plus (fst x) (fst y), plus (snd x) (snd y)) : forall U V : AbelianGroup, U * V -> U * V -> U * V Arguments U, V are implicit and maximally inserted
surjective_pairing : forall (A B : Type) (p : A * B), p = (fst p, snd p)
revK = fun (T : Type) (_top_assumption_ : seq T) => (fun (_evar_0_ : (fun l : seq T => rev (rev l) = l) [::]) (_evar_0_0 : forall (a : T) (l : seq T), (fun l0 : seq T => rev (rev l0) = l0) l -> (fun l0 : seq T => rev (rev l0) = l0) (a :: l)) => list_ind (fun l : seq T => rev (rev l) = l) _evar_0_ _evar_0_0 _top_assumption_) eq_refl (fun (x : T) (s : seq T) (IHs : rev (rev s) = s) => (fun _evar_0_ : rev (rcons (rev s) x) = x :: s => eq_ind_r (fun _pattern_value_ : seq T => rev _pattern_value_ = x :: s) _evar_0_ (rev_cons x s)) ((fun _evar_0_...
nth_zip_cond : forall (S0 T : Type) (p : S0 * T) (s : seq S0) (t : seq T) (i : nat), nth p (zip s t) i = (if ssrnat.leq (S i) (size (zip s t)) then (nth (fst p) s i, nth (snd p) t i) else p)
SF_ly = fun s : SF_seq => unzip2 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq T
SetoidList.findA_NoDupA : forall (A B : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence eqA -> forall (eqA_dec : forall x y : A, {eqA x y} + {~ eqA x y}) (l : seq (A * B)) (a : A) (b : B), SetoidList.NoDupA (fun p p' : A * B => eqA (fst p) (fst p')) l -> SetoidList.InA (fun p p' : A * B => eqA (fst p) (fst p') /\ snd p = snd p') (a, b) l < -> SetoidList.findA (fun a' : A => if eqA_dec a a' then true else false) l = Some b
map_rcons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), [seq f i | i <- rcons s x] = rcons [seq f i | i <- s] (f x)
seq.zip_rcons : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T) (x : S) (y : T), size s = size t -> zip (rcons s x) (rcons t y) = rcons (zip s t) (x, y)
behead_rcons : forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), (0 < size s0)%nat -> behead (rcons s0 t) = rcons (behead s0) t where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type]
zip_rcons : forall (s0 : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T) (hs : ?S) (ht : ?T), size s0 = size t -> zip (rcons s0 hs) (rcons t ht) = rcons (zip s0 t) (hs, ht) where ?S : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type] ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq h : R * T |- Type]
List.in_split_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : seq (A * B)) (p : A * B), List.In p l -> List.In (fst p) (fst (List.split l))
sumn_rcons : forall (s : seq nat) (n : nat), sumn (rcons s n) = ssrnat.addn (sumn s) n
prod_ball = fun (U V : UniformSpace) (x : U * V) (eps : R) (y : U * V) => ball (fst x) eps (fst y) /\ ball (snd x) eps (snd y) : forall U V : UniformSpace, U * V -> R -> U * V -> Prop Arguments U, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ _ R_scope _]
unzip1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> unzip1 (zip s t) = s
